result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Arthur Geib was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Arthur Geib

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Arthur Geib in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Robert Arthur Geib in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Huber privileges for road crew at House of Correction.   

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-08-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont contacted the clerk requesting matter be adjourned for a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled on August 7, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.  Attorney Garvin Guimont will notify the Sheriff's Dept. to have the defendant produced.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Target located at 2950 S. Chase Avenue.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Arthur Geib in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Defendant Robert Arthur Geib in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert Arthur Geib
Current: 2420 West Burnham Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 07-20-2015)
Prior: 2320 West Burnham Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court earlier.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed:   Discharge Summary.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed office contact.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed telephone contact.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Robert Arthur Geib not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Target located at 2950 S. Chase Avenue.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDER/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Arthur Geib in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Robert Arthur Geib in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
